website_summaries.verdict: Light-duty but unique, this reacher is outfitted with a suction cup to help you change light bulbs without climbing a step stool.
pros: Suction cup helps reacher grip everything from pill bottles to light bulbs and cell phones
Ergonomic trigger for convenient use, built-in hanging ring for when it's not in use
cons: Not particularly strong, and has no ability to lock the jaw

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Great grabber. Easy to use. Light weight. However I keep needing to reattach the nut and screw in suction cup holder part. Feel this shouldn’t come off as easily as it does. Edited a few days later. Cups continue to fall off and metalpiece poke off. Not lifting things heavier than a small pill bottle, tissues, remote, crochet hook, pen, etc. make very cheaply.
customer_reviews.author: K. BroussardTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: ... these for 4 or five years and they worked great I bought a couple others of different design which ...
customer_reviews.text: I had pair of these for 4 or five years and they worked great I bought a couple others of different design which didn't work as well. I finally wore out the first pair and after using the new set for twenty minutes or so, both gripping cups fell off along with the tiny screws that held them in place, lost in the grass. Very disappointed. Now I need to find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a day! The nut keeps falling out and my husband needs to keep putting it back in .. Maybe mine was just defective to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy's mom

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product... Makes it so much easier to reach things on the floor... Behind things and under things... Strong too... Picks up cell phones.. My big purse... Fully loaded ... Tv remotes... A big help in my recovery.. But will still use after my recovery....thank you
customer_reviews.author: cindi

customer_reviews.title: Very Flimsy Grabber
customer_reviews.text: This grabber is not worth the money, even though it works for picking up small objects, I wouldn't use it for cans or anything as heavy as a can. Bought this thinking it would be like the Arcmate EZ Reacher I own, the Vive reacher is far weaker. I recommend the Arcmate EZ Reacher. It's sturdy and last long if not abused, I use one at work also. I have even picked up small bricks, lots of tree branches and and even very tiny screws that have been dropped
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Screws Loose 😜
customer_reviews.text: One of the suction cups fell off and the screw got lost on the first use which made it useless. So if you do get it be sure you tighten thescrews before your first use. But if they’re that poorly made I’ve got to think they wouldn’t last too long.
customer_reviews.author: arieliondotcom

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the return window closed before I recovered enough from surgery to open the package/use product. It is bent at about a 45 degree angle. The slim packaging it arrived in was damaged in the same area, so it was likely the package handling that caused the bend. It cracked when I bent it back into almost a straight line. I don't think it will last too long. It's too bad about the damaged part because the grabber mechanisms at both top and bottom work really well. Will use until the crack causes the whole thing to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: jangls

customer_reviews.title: Was great until it broke on the first use
customer_reviews.text: Was absolutely great the first time i used it until the nut and suction cup fell off and got lost in a bag of trash i had picked up off the street. Up until that time i was really very happy with it. Now it is garbage to be recycled. Seems a shame to buy a replacement suction cup and nut/screw after one use
customer_reviews.author: Rydeen

customer_reviews.title: Grabba no good
customer_reviews.text: I found that Grabber to be a waste of time and money. Upon taking it out of the box and trying to pick up simple item. The suction cook fell off. It's kinds of clumsy to manipulate. And doesn't seem to be able to pick up anything. I'm so upset that I accidentally threw away the Box because I would have been sending it back to Amazon. Will I buy again? I really don't think so.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it broke
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight compared to other products which I thought would be a benefit. However, it broke (internal cable snapped) while in use on a relatively easy task - pulling a small empty box off a top shelf in the closet. What's frustrating is to see where the cable snapped - right where it goes into handle. There's no way to repair this tool, so its off to the recycle bin. Nice idea but definitely not "heavy duty" as its advertised
customer_reviews.author: Sharkiebob

customer_reviews.title: Vive Suction Cup Reacher Grabber is the BEST mobility aid!
customer_reviews.text: Im stuck in a wheelchair with a broken foot. I drop things constantly. This suction cup grabber is the best mobility aid you can buy. The 32 inch reach enables you to get things up high or down low without reaching, bending or frustration. The handle is sturdy, the suction cups securely pick up everything, from a crumb on the floor to lifting my dog's water bowl so I can refill it. Even if I wasn't in a wheel chair; everything on the top shelf of the pantry is now within reach.. and I can change my own light bulbs without using a step ladder. This was an EXCELLENT buy!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Moore

customer_reviews.title: I say, BUY it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my olde man. He loves it. Sturdy and dependable. He goes through these things pretty regularly, I think I buy one for him every year. Thought this one might last longer then the rest but he lost one of the suction and we never were able to find it. Apparently after much usage the screws had come off, so be sure to check the bolts and tighten them every few months.
customer_reviews.author: yong

customer_reviews.title: A useful extra set of long arms, we can all use,
customer_reviews.text: A huge relief for those having difficulty bending, after back surgery...I use it to take my laundry out of my washer, dryer, pick the numerous things I drop, the list goes on. The one my Occupational therapist gave at the hospital doesn't have the round suction grip, which gives you more grab room. It would be helpful though if it had a grab lock feature, because wet laundry can be heavy, takes work to get jeans and towels out but so much better than without one. Thankyou for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Good Price!
customer_reviews.text: This one is sturdier than my old one, but also is lightweight, for me an important feature. My old one is still in use, but I had need for a second one. This one looked good and the price was right, so I ordered it, and am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: HazelnutTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: My helping Hands
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful reacher. Much sturdier than the one it replaced. Being barely 5 feet 1/2 inch tall with short arms is really a handicap. Use it getting clothes out of the washing machine, fishing items down from shelves, opening and closing blinds that over my desk. Things I cannot get too without a small ladder. After having an accident with my 2 step ladders a few years back, I do not climb anymore. The Grabber is one of the greatest essentials in my life. Senior Citizen, enjoying my 80's.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Lady

customer_reviews.title: it does the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a slightly different style which I actually like better. This works fine but it takes more strength to operate it. I am sure I will get used to it in time. The old one did not have the suction cup grip and I may find I like it better after using it for a while **Update** I really don't like this as well as the old one. I found the old one on a garage shelf where I must have set it down. Don't use this one at all and will probably give it away
customer_reviews.author: Katcon

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: So my washer and dryer are raised up on a pedestal and there is very little room behind them and the wall. I can't say how many things I have accidentally dropped back there, ranging from tools to socks to whatever! This tool is a lifesaver and can pick up the smallest thing (like a drillbit) super far away in the hardest to reach area, while surrounded by water hoses and a dryer vent and the rubber grip holds like no other so that if you've lost anything to the narrow depths on the unknown you are sure to be able to retrieve it with this bad boy. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C*sShine^

customer_reviews.title: what a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: purchased 2, first one i took out of the box had a loose wire strand which penetrated my index finger all the way to the bone. (Really hurt). trimed strand and it lasted exactly 3 hrs picking up pine cones in my yard. wired disconnected internally. Took the othe to continue it didn't last 2 hrs when the wire came loos. about the only thing good on these is the rubber cups. i can use these on the Arcteck ones which i purchased over 2 years ago and a still working fine. need new cups though. (Which i now have)
customer_reviews.author: Erich Schmunk

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable grabber, a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it claims to do. The internal mechanism is pretty flimsy, and rotating the thing around will make it squeak as the inner tension rods move around and slide against each other. The end grabbers don't actually line up perfectly. There's probably about 70% overlap of the pads. It works for its intended purpose but I really wonder how long it's going to hold up. We only use it around the apartment for getting cat toys out from behind furniture (for the most part). If you want to use a grabber for something more robust like picking up loads of trash outside (highway cleanup etc.), I might advise you to look for something sturdier than this.
customer_reviews.author: Jc

customer_reviews.title: Meh....
customer_reviews.text: this think is OK at best. yes it is light weight. We got this after getting a new washing machine with a large tub. My wife has trouble reaching the bottom of the tub. However, it doesn't have much pinching force, and cannot lift more than a few pounds... one or two damp shirts at a time. My first one broke immediately after unboxing it, before i even tried to lift anything. returned through amazon. Got a replacement quickly. I don't have a lot of experience with this kind of device, but if i were to order a new one I would not re-order this one.
customer_reviews.author: zBrendon

customer_reviews.title: Mine lasted 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I hate to leave bad reviews and I don't leave too many all together. I bought this last October and haven't tried it until today. It lasted about 30 minutes picking up pine cones and the cable slipped out of the part its crimped in. Iv'e had one similar to this and lasted 10 years before someone stole it. I had used it so much I replaced the suction cups once. Lots of money for a 30 minute job. Maybe I got a bad one because of all the good reviews? Wish I had tried it out when I got it so I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of two different grabbers I purchased to find which might work better. Answer: both are great. (The other type came in a pair, so that was nice.) This one has suction cups and not only picks up, but can also work on lightbulbs. And when you pull the trigger for squeezing, the "fingers" pull in close in a way that lets you reach into smaller areas than the other kind of grabber I also purchased. Glad to have both types, as I am to soon have surgery that will require me to use the grabbers. Even after I am better, these grabbers will be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Selina

customer_reviews.title: Does not fold in half like most which I am hoping will keep it working ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Does not fold in half like most which I am hoping will keep it working longer as those that fold seemed to have an issue I think because of the cable constantly being folded. It will pick up very small things & also does well with heavier things. I have not used it to reach higher in to cabinets to grab cans or objects. It suits my needs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: True love! Buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I must have it for a couple of years now and use it daily. I am pushing 60 and anyone my age should get one unless you love to bend down and pick things up that fall or get on your hands and knees to retrieve things. If you enjoy that then you don't need one. I happen to hate getting down on my hands and knees. This thing picks up most things that fall on the ground like coins, credit cards. vitamin pills, bottle caps etc.. Love, love, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Fight the Good Fight

customer_reviews.title: It is not all what I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: We needed it to have a strong grip in order to help my mother open her Velcro shoe closures. It has such a weak grip that it just slips right off, and the round rubber suction cups can't even penetrate the Velcro to lift the edge closure to grip in the first place. So we are going to be sending it back. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever did
customer_reviews.text: how does anyone live without one of these? You know when you drop a sock behind the washer? This can get it. I love it. So easy to use? I see some people talk about designs and pistol grips and whatever else. This has been the best thing for me because it saves me from crawling on the floor to retrieve dropped objects, or wrenching my back or stooping when I don't need to. Just reach in with this thing and it grabs what I need to get. It's so simple and so awesome. I'm surprised I had to learn about it from an old folks' home.
customer_reviews.author: K. Eoghan SchwopeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3rd use
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this. I was able to use it only three times though, the spring that helps with the handle just SNAPPED! Now it's completely useless. Had to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Deana Zhollis

customer_reviews.title: How did I ever get along without it?
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! I recently had to spine surgeries one on my neck and one on my lower back. With not being able to reach for things or bend over this thing has bend a God send. Oh oh not to mention once you get into bed or sit down and get comfortable there's always, always that item you need off of the dresser or table that you wouldn't be able to reach without getting up again. I've had it since November 2016 and not one problem. I keep it close by and when I move it moves. Even when I go to the bathroom too take a shower. Would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonetta Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Can pick-up a dime, near two (2) years later.
customer_reviews.text: We were buying the cheapest models; and, having to replace them year after year. This item is going on two years old and is just like the first day we received. Sturdy and durable. Despite our toddler abusing this in whatever way they can, including banging the cups on the floor, like it was a drumstick. This can still pick-up a dime, from the floor. Yes we would buy again and yes, such is worthy of your consideration. (The solid bar provides the strength needed when picking-up heavy items, like that 5LB bag of floor that fell.) The trigger has worked flawlessly, as does the suction cups, which have not fallen off nor need tightened. YES we would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY FIRST with the VIVE Reacher Grabber
customer_reviews.text: The reacher grabber is great. Before when I needed an item from an upper shelf, I had to use a small step ladder. Using the small ladder didn't seem to be the safest way to reach items from the cabinet's upper shelves. No problem now that I have the Vive Suction Cup Reacher Grabber! Then there are items on the floor or on the ground outside, no more bending over. It's a WIN all around. SAFETY FIRST
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Nail

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I have recently had back surgery and these work great. I can even pick up papers and coins in addition to the obvious larger items and still keep my surgeon happy! I like this model much more than my older folding model that kept folding at the most inopportune times. After six months I am still delighted. I picked up sticks and ball moss in my yard this week. I still don't have permission to bend and this grabber helped me get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: David Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty? Not So Sure
customer_reviews.text: The package and grabber arrived in good condition. When I opened the box, however, and removed the tool, I noticed right away that the length of the reacher was shorter, weight lighter, and rod thinner than a similar one I've had for years. The product did not impress me as "heavy-duty" --something the company touted in the advertisement. Very misleading. Light-duty would be a more appropriate description. So, the ad misleads the consumer on this score. In the future, it would be wise to hold such a grabber in your hand to ensure it meets your expectations before buying it. As a light-duty grabber, it would probably be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Aristotle

customer_reviews.title: Tighten cups.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Good for light objects. Tighten suction cups before use.
customer_reviews.author: JimBurg

customer_reviews.title: Probably my favorite purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this gadget!!!! This is the 3rd one I’ve ordered because I gave one to an elderly neighbor who tasked himself with picking up trash in our neighborhood and was bending over to pick up trash, and I added one for our bar business for the same reason. I actually LIKE walking around with a large trash receptacle on a 2-wheel dolly around my business property picking up bottles, poop, the tiniest piece of paper, etc. with this thing. Probably great thinking therapy as well. And did I say I loved this gizmo? A definite recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Showlowjoe

customer_reviews.title: I can get all the wet laundry out of the washing machine.  The grabber hold on to each garment.
customer_reviews.text: I like this grabber very much. We purchased a new clothes washer but it is too deep for me and my daughter. This grabber holds on to each peace including beach towels and brings it on up to the top of the washer. It is very light and I am very happy we found it.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING GRABBER STICK
customer_reviews.text: This is a carefully designed device that is capable of picking up just about anything from the floor. The rubber cups have tiny air holes that prevent the cups from locking shut, and the stick is designed to give much better grasping power than sticks with "claws." I've been able to pick up pencils, single sheets of paper, heavy plates in the bottom rack of a dishwasher, jars and cans on upper shelves, computer recharging cords, small pieces of cooking debris, and more. I haven't tried to pick up a dime from a wooden floor, but I wouldn't bet against this stick.
customer_reviews.author: GLV

customer_reviews.title: When the floor looks so far away
customer_reviews.text: Anyone with back troubles knows the feeling. Is it worth the effort to slowly bend over to pick up a tiny object that you dropped, especially at the end of the day when your back is really hurting? You need one of these! While they are great for reaching up, 9 times out of 10 I use it for picking things up off the floor. I even use it outside to pick up fallen pine cones. I have several throughout the house and use every one. Great for organizing shoes in the closet. You can up up slightly larger items too. I think 4 lbs would be the limit.
customer_reviews.author: W. L SPAKOWSKI

customer_reviews.title: Grabber with excellent force control
customer_reviews.text: Some of our hens make it a sport to place their eggs under the coop, in a spot I can barely get to. Not anymore. With this grabber I am able to reach under there without problems. The beautiful thing about this model is how much control you have over the force you use. I am able to move and handle raw eggs without breaking them. But I have also used the grabber to lift a heavy wrench that fell behind the workbench and it did that perfectly too. I am happy with the purchase and I expect this to last a while too. Looks well made for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: batmick

customer_reviews.title: Does not lock.
customer_reviews.text: The claw does not lock, when chaining a lightbulb you must keep the suction cups closed by continuously squeezing the handle and either rotating your body or the tool...both very awkward and any lessening of your grip brings the lightbulb down on its own if it is close to being totally unscrewed. Great for trash pickup and very lightweight objects up high... that are unbreakable.
customer_reviews.author: Neysa Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Grip, and So lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in anticipation of needing it after my spine surgery last month. Wow, how glad I am. Since I cannot bend or twist this has been a lifesaver. Picks up dropped washcloths, tiny pills, utensils, scraps of paper, you name it! I also use it for getting my laundry out of the dryer (someone moves it from washer to dryer for me), sure it takes awhile but I love doing it myself. It's a lightweight grabber so for something heavy it won't work, but I should not be lifting heavy items anyway. It's perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: SuzB

customer_reviews.title: Feels a little cheap, but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this trash-grabber. It does feel a little cheap and flimsy, but it absolutely works for it's purpose. I was able to pick up small pieces of trash like cigarette butts, bottle-caps, and Taco Bell seasoning packs, but also heavy stuff like a phone book, beer bottles, and heavy trash items. My wrist did not get sore. I like my new trash grabber!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha S.

customer_reviews.title: Help for us shorties.
customer_reviews.text: At 4'11", I don't know why I didn't purchase this sooner! It reaches so many things! You can not use it for heavy items, but for reaching small light things, it is great. My elderly mother, who lives with us, can use it to get down bags of chips and things from the higher kitchen shelves. Also use it to retrieve cat toys from under the bed. I can pick up a "Honey Bear" honey container (12 oz.)using the suction cups, but that is about as heavy as I would trust them. i would have given t a five if it had opened wider.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia A Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: **VERY GOOD,  LOVIN IT**
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time buying this kinda of thing & LOVE IT, I'm NOT that old or disable to using this, BUT I USE this pick up junks around my house, dont get my hands dirty or on my carport roof hard to reach , like small tree branches or paper or things people drop around my house in street or blow off to my property just nasty stuffs to grab with hands!! ...work great & strong enough to pick little heavy stuffs 2 nice tight grabber , good quality well built , did a GREAT CHOICE , chose this one between the rest!
customer_reviews.author: 80SChild

customer_reviews.title: Best gripper ever!
customer_reviews.text: i originally bought this to change light bulbs that i can't reach without standing on a stool/ladder. However, at my age with COPD i'm not comfortable climbing stools/ladders. This is great for changing light bulbs! Today i am purchasing two more grippers. One to be used to open my living room drapes. I'm not tall enough to reach the top and slide them open easily. The second one will be used to help me clean the bath rub and the floor around the base of the toilet. i use disposable wash rags which i can use to cover the gripper end. These grippers are great or any one with a disability.
customer_reviews.author: Kathey

customer_reviews.title: Grab this Grabber!
customer_reviews.text: Don't wait until you NEED this item (after surgery, disabled, etc...): Buy it now! Whether or not you think you need this item, I guarantee it is helpful to have around. Right now, I am not allowed to bend or twist due to back surgery, and this Reacher Grabber is a lifesaver. I am able to do much more of my own caretaking and helping around the house than I would without it. The Reacher Grabber can pick up a dropped pill, or get wet laundry out of the washer and into the dryer. Just amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Mom to MAKE

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT ! Saved my back
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product. I have a little back injury and am recovering from surgery to my lower leg and this has been a lifesaver. The suction cups enabled me to pick up coins and small pieces of lint or laundry or socks ; Anything I need to grab off the floor this is been wonderful and has saved my back. Thank you very much I’d have one on every room if I could
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this out, right out of the box. I grasped a container that is about 4" wide, squeezed the trigger and heard a pop. The grip went slack. I discovered that an internal wire had come loose, and it looked too difficult to figure out why and/ or how to repair it. This gripper is stated to be "heavy-duty". I do not think that is true at all. On the positive side, it is indeed nicely lightweight and the suction cups seem to work okay, but the thing just broke way too easily. I'm returning and not replacing. Going to find something else that is truly heavy-duty.
customer_reviews.author: Ferbereyes

customer_reviews.title: My wife has a different brand unit that has mechanical ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a different brand unit that has mechanical grabbers. When she saw my Reacher Grabber with suction cup grabbers, she wanted to trade with me. Now she wants to borrows mine all the time. To impress her with how mine can pick up small objects, I showed her that I was able to pick up a quarter off the floor. I bought mine to use in my garage, but now my wife will not let me to take it out of our house. Maybe, I should order a second Reacher Grabber by VIVE.
customer_reviews.author: Gunther

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed - #1 it had a slight bend in the ...
customer_reviews.text: The "Reacher" that I had used for 3 year finally broke so I ordered this one. I was very disappointed - #1 it had a slight bend in the handle about a foot up upon delivery - when I pushed on it to straighten it - 2 "holes" appeared in the seams. I knew right away that the quality was not as good as the previous one I had. I should have returned it - but needed it right away as I mow a lot of ground (10 hrs a week) and needed it to pick up garbage while mowing. I would not order this Reacher again.
customer_reviews.author: Connie S.

customer_reviews.title: OUCH! This thing bites
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. My grip is weak due to MS and for some reason this grabber pinches the crap out of my fingers/hand if I am not careful. I own several and this is the first to bite. Failed to notice the grabber does not pivot to a vertical grab either. On a positive note I purchased this one for the hanging potential on the handle. So it hangs on a magnetic hook on the side of the fridge. Many do not have this feature.
customer_reviews.author: GigiRM

customer_reviews.title: A very useful tool.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to reach things on a high shelf as well as picking up trash and debris that blows or falls into the yard. The feature I appreciate most is the range of things it can handle from the thinnest scrap of rice paper to jars and cans. I can't be sure of the most weight I can lift with it but it is enough for my purposes. As to the star ratings I'm giving it a 5 across the board although I can't really assess "suction power". I didn't actually notice "suction".
customer_reviews.author: Sally-O

customer_reviews.title: Great little grabber
customer_reviews.text: Although the grabber lines look too thin to pick up anything, it's not failed me so far in anything I've wanted to pick up, and the slim design helps it get into small spaces that I can't get to on my own, since it's much longer and thinner than an arm. I haven't tried changing a light bulb with it yet. I resisted buying this product for quite some time because I thought it would make me feel like a helpless old lady (even though I'm neither, lol), but now that I have it, I've realized it's a great tool for any age.
customer_reviews.author: mla

customer_reviews.title: Suction Barely Works
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I thought they would be useful emptying the bottom rack of the dishwasher because I couldn't bend after surgery. The suction cups barely grabbed the lightest dish and ended up dropping the dish back into the dishwasher. The suction cups are very small and weak and you have to squeeze the trigger handle hard to secure whatever you are lifting, especially anything with a smooth surface. They did work on other things like clothing, but a regular grabber worked better. Great concept. Poor execution. Make the suction cups larger and sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Carol K.

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product. Falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast and item arrived in good condition. But we used it for 40 minutes cleaning up garbage in our local creek for the first time today and a nut fell off the end of the grabber. Had to finish project using my hands. So now I’m searching Home Depot for a replacement nut to see if I can salvage my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dana G. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Even picks up dropped soda bottles
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely light, yet strong (although they say to limit it to 5 lbs lifted). Not only is the action smoother and softer than any other grabber I have used, its suction cups make it possible to pick up curved items easily. One of my biggest problems at work is when soda bottles are dropped; I can't bend far enough to pick them up by hand and my other grabber doesn't hold them well (flat pads slide off the bottles). This one makes it easy to pick up the bottles, even filled.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but the end points don’t line up...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since after 5 years my original one broke in half on the bend point. I wanted to make sure the next one I got did not have a bend point to avoid it breaking it half. This one seems pretty sturdy. The major thing wrong is that when you squeeze the handle the end points do not line up. For me it doesn’t matter since I solely use it to open/close my ceiling vents everyday, but if you wanted to use it for picking smaller things up this won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Kitchen Aid
customer_reviews.text: For years, I've had to use these types of grippers in order to get things off shelves that have been out of reach. Some have worked well and some were so poorly made that they weren't worth the shipping costs. However, I do like the Vive suction cup grippers. I have a lot of arthritis in both hands so I need a gripper that is sturdy with good griping power so that I don't get conked in the head by the canned pears. This gripper has been worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: MagSam

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It works just as described. I ordered it because I hurt my back and needed something to temporarily help grab little things without bending. I figured it would be helpful for reaching things on a high shelf when my back heals. I have high ceilings and thought this one would be especially helpful for changing a bulb in my ceiling fans. While I haven’t done this yet, I did reach up and grab a bulb and I’m sure it will work. I’ve only had it a week and so far it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: JEA

customer_reviews.title: It’s working as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: So far everything is good. I am partially disabled, which includes weakness in my hands. The box was sitting unopened for a few days then I dropped a Zone Bar between my night dresser and the bed. I couldn’t get to it nor move the furniture so I opened my package and sure enough the Reacher Grabber was able to snag it. I then used it to pick up a dozen used Kleenex on the far away night stand on the other side of the bed. Noticed something behind the night stand and used it to recapture a lost glove. I’m happy with it so far. I also used it to pick up a large empty drinking glass.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for post-op back surgery
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I would do without this tool. I've been using it constantly for three weeks after major back surgery. It easily grabs a glass off a shelf, and outside, I can pick up a hose, a fairly heavy metal sprinkler, pull a weed, and even pick baby pickles right off the vine. I pick up laundry and put it in the machine, fallen items off the floor, and the list goes on and on. You need this if you are told not to bend for three months! (or even a week!).
customer_reviews.author: LibraryLisa

customer_reviews.title: Very useful following hip surgery
customer_reviews.text: I kept one in the bedroom, to help me dress. The other was kept in the living room for easy access. Will save to give to anyone else I know that can't bend over 90 degrees to grab things. Sometimes, however, the hook type of grabbing stick came in handy. And, I wish they included a small prong on the outside of the tool and that it would be magnetized. That's very useful if you need to pick up metal objects (or paper clips, e.g. from the floor).
customer_reviews.author: Barb Martenson

customer_reviews.title: A bad version of a better product
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a number of reacher/grabbers, so I've had a range of experiences. The best ones were made by Alcoa & the Vive reachers LOOK very similar, but are without question the most uncomfortable I've used. The squeeze handle is awkwardly small, and that's from someone with an average size hand. Something about the way the handle moved pinched my hand slightly with every use. I tried using only a couple of fingers, but it didn't help. Trying to adapt my grip made picking anything up impossible. I have already arranged to return them & ordered 2 of the Alcoa brand again instead. Well worth it for the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Mom

customer_reviews.title: SAVES THE BACK
customer_reviews.text: I'm 75 years old and a disabled Veteran and maintain a 400 acre natural island, see it at burlingtonisland.org picking up alum. cans for recycling can be painful if you have to keep bending over, and over, and over. I have recycled nearly 25,000 cans off the island now and without this handy tool I could not do it. It would be nice is this fine company or Amazon could donate about a dozen of these to our island clean up volunteers.
customer_reviews.author: RHINO

customer_reviews.title: Securely picks up items
customer_reviews.text: I got this because the cabinets in m new kitchen go all the way up to the ceiling. This helps me grasp non-fragile items that are a little too high. The suction cups grab things securely and allow me to bring it down. Make a loop from a piece of paracord to hang it up on a hook for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: The Cashmere Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Served me well through spinal fusion and hip replacement surgeries
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made product. Light weight, functional, and durable. Useful for picking up small objects like coins and paper. Also good for help with shoes and clothes when getting dressed. Essential for someone with bending or squatting restrictions after surgery. My only suggestion to make it better is for the manufacturer to make the squeezing force a little greater. It does 95% of what I need it for and I am definitely glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: GREGORY O. BUCKLEY

customer_reviews.title: Handle is for tiny hands only ... not regular size hands, certainly not large hands... disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Whose hands would this reacher’s handle be sized for??? Not mine, and I do not have what I consider to be “large hands” ... because I know folks with large hands and that aint me. “But” the handle on this reacher is particularly uncomfortable to use. It makes me hate using it. I have been using another brand of grabber for the last five years and I decided to get a second to keep in the back of the house... I chose this highly rated one here on Amazon but I dont see how or why this is so highly rated... I can’t recommend this whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Ray6166

customer_reviews.title: For those hard to reach spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'1" tall, but in the house we moved into a year ago there are shelves in the kitchen that I cannot reach without a step stool and at my age a step stool is out of the question. This device was perfect for putting items we don't use very often to getting other items off the shelves. I also used it to reach things that had fallen behind a bookcase and a desk with having to move furniture. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Oklamathman

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'0". I cant' reach anything. Not even my shelves over my washer and dryer. So this is my lifesaver. Incredibly good grip on most everything. Grasps so well I even use it to pick up pins out of carpet and pieces of paper on the floor. I sew so I've always got stray paper and pattern pieces on the carpet. Can sit when I'm tired and pick up things with it, and from there put it in the trash. Would not be without it.
customer_reviews.author: urbangal

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery, and very powerful suction grips for retrieving items when you are unable to bend/maneuver. ***edited to add this is a total life saver. I would buy it over and over again!!!!
customer_reviews.author: tiredandold

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. Cable broke on first use. This is very lightweight. I'm sure it works fine for featherweight pick ups. But I grabbed a small (5" x 8"0) chalkboard from behind the kitchen cabinet. It grabbed it fine. But when I tried to pull it out from between the cabinet and the fridge, the side springs were too wide. they compressed between the cabinet and the fridge and the cable broke. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Poorman

customer_reviews.title: Suction power does not suck too well, but it is sturdy, and still very useful
customer_reviews.text: I am a shorter person, so the Vive Suction Cup Reacher Grabber helps me a great deal. I cannot reach items on the upper shelves, and this grabber reaches them for me and grabs them and brings them down, or up if I want. It works very well. The suction cups at the end are only okay. They will assist to remove a light bulb but do not rely on them to pick up anything too heavy. use the main grabbing area to grab heavier items. It is safer that way.
customer_reviews.author: Heat

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm recovering from a back problem and bought a grabber at a local store. It broke on the 3rd use. I returned it and got a new one of the same type. It broke after 5 uses. This Vive grabber doesn't have the design flaw of the other. It grabs well, is a bit longer, and still is lightweight. I use it to feed my 3 cats, lowering the filled bowls to the floor. It's been very helpful to me, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: jcpdx

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my brother. So far no complaints from him. Because I didn't see this item and use them other wise I will give five stars. I usually give five stars for item I buy. Little tips for shopping online, 1. Read the descriptions of item before you buy I see so many unfair reviews because customers get wrong one without reading. 2. Check worst reviews and use your critical thinking. 3. You get what you paid. Didn't expect unrealistic quality when you only pay fees dollars or expect item will never be broken. Tell me something it will never broken I will buy with no Brain
customer_reviews.author: Little Cindy Riding HoodTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than the light weight fold down one!
customer_reviews.text: As a physically challenged person, I was having problems pulling my pants over me feet, so my Occupational Therapist suggested a choice of two types of reachers. I chose the heavy duty one, because my light one doesn't work as well. This one has a strong grip and easily pulls up my pants. My husband lifted mouthwash, lotion, and a shoe, and all of them stayed cradled in the suction cups. Spend a few more dollars and get the heavy duty one. You'll be happy that you did.
customer_reviews.author: writethought

customer_reviews.title: Finally a grabber that grabs!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several styles of grabbers and this one meets all my needs. It grabs properly so you don't feel the glass jar is going to slip and crash on the stove top or floor. I will say that my rating fo sturdiness is a 4 because there is a limit as to how much weight it can handle. I did get a jar of pasta sauce down without a crash or slip but I did feel that would be it. No big jars of pickles. But all in all it was a good find.
customer_reviews.author: A. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but looks fairly sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This product looks sturdy enough for long term use. I didn't give a perfect rating due to the fact that when triggered, the grippers at the end don't exactly align. The suction cups aren't aligned which could be a problem depending on what you are grabbing. I was able to grab wet toilet paper on the road with this so although my suction cups weren't aligned, it was still able to grab delicate trash (my neighbors house was TP'd by kids unfortunately). The base stem is metal so I don't think this would break easily. Overall this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Cousin Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge help to me right now. I had a fall a short while ago and broke my back in several places. No damages to spinal column but you can imagine the pain and of course the limited ability to do every day things. The little suction cup make this grabber work superb. I can pick up a dime off a tile floor with little effort or a heavy can of tomatoes of the top shelf in cupboard with ease. It would be difficult for me to find anything that works better than this item. And the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Nice and STRONG
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. Definitely helps with avoiding touching things at the grocery store. I’m a very short person so I use this for reaching and grabbing things from high up shelves. This little grabber is a LOT stronger than I expected. I’ve picked up a bottle of bleach, a bottle of wine, books, large packets of paper Towels and more. The only thing I wish is that I had two so I could duel weld them like a cowboy 😆
customer_reviews.author: SnowyMoss

customer_reviews.title: Great for picking up trash
customer_reviews.text: I got this for picking up trash when I go hiking, maybe making it a little easier, more fun or to help me pick up some things I'd be hesitant to pick up otherwise. This thing has done the job, helping to pick up things weighing up to a couple of pounds. It's described as having suction cups at the end, but I haven't really used this feature. I expect that once you use it to pick up enough rough or dirty objects the suction cups aren't going to offer much suction.
customer_reviews.author: David Sturgill

customer_reviews.title: Will ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, since this item is a #1 best seller, I was hesitant about writing a 3 star review; But, decided to anyway(a very short one). This tool is well made in my opinion. I am still sending it back for a refund. The reason is that it has very little gripping power compared to others I have used(and there is nothing you can do to change it). I am glad others have been satisfied with it. Ron
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: THE MOST HELPFUL TOOL I HAVE EVER USED
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are in our 80s, still living in our own home and taking care of things ourselves. Because of various limitations caused by arthritis and brain injury, we sometimes have difficulty picking up things from the floor or reaching over our heads. The Vive Suction Cup Reacher Grabber is just what we need. We especially appreciate the ability to change an overhead light bulb without the danger of being on a ladder. The suction helps keep a secure grip on the things we pick up, and it works on the tiniest pieces of paper, buttons, etc. that are dropped on the floor. This is indeed the most helpful tool I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Stachura

customer_reviews.title: bst reacher ever !
customer_reviews.text: I've had many reachers over the past 18 years of my life as a paraplegic. this is the first one that didn't fall apart after a year or two. usually the suction cups come of and/or the center part, where the reacher folds in half, breaks. it's all in the design. this reacher doesn't bend and the suction cups are securely bolted on. and best of all it can pick up the smallest objects such as a tooth pick or a dime. I purchased this 2 years ago and have not had a single problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: miata

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work like it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: The clamps don't close and suctions are misaligned. So cheaply made. I owned one of these different brand that folded in the middle for space efficiency, but this one poor quality and defective. I hope no one thinks this one is how they're supposed to be. This won't be able to grab anything. Waste of time to have to go to return.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian P

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After cataract surgery I was told not to bend or lift items over 5 lbs for six weeks so I bought this grabber for this reason. It picked up most items I wanted and if it didn’t, I toolbox that as the item was over 5 lbs. only times I had trouble with it was picking up clothes to launder. The suction cups would wrap around the clothes at times and I had to unravel the item. Aside from that, it was great. I would buy another if needed and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mern

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life ??
customer_reviews.text: I had back surgery in December and the doctor suggested that I buy one. I should have gotten this tool YEARS ago. It was a lifesaver during the time that I couldn't bend, lift or twist, but now (three months after surgery) I use this thing for EVERYTHING!! Granddaughter's toys on the floor - check! Dog toys under the couch - check! Dropped my pen under the desk - check, check, check!!! I am going to buy this thing for all of my friends and family for Christmas. Seriously GET ONE NOW !! Your life will improve in ways you never knew.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten T.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: My wife recently injured her back (crushed a disk pretty bad), and she asked me to buy one of these for her. I did about 15 minutes of research and found this well-reviewed one. Honestly I ordered it thinking it was more of a toy than anything, and I was definitely surprised with how helpful it has been. She's able to nearly function almost normally with the help of this thing. I really didn't expect it to be able to pick up a full soda can. Pros: Made my wife happy for less than $15. She's using this constantly. Cons: *crickets*
customer_reviews.author: Adam S.

customer_reviews.title: Thought this would work better
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give a poor review, but I had more expectations from this thing. I'm short and was looking for something I could use to take down things from my upper cupboard shelves. The prongs don't open wide enough to grab a can of soup and don't have any lift capacity for even a small box of spaghetti. I suppose I could use it to take marshmallows out of a bag one by one but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: cindy trane

customer_reviews.title: It Broke
customer_reviews.text: We bought two and the second time we tried to use one of them, it broke. The grip just let go and the handle went limp. We are afraid to use the other one. It just sits on a hook. We have a grabber that has lasted regular use for many years. We wanted these to be able to have easy access from anywhere around the house. Needless to say, we are still looking to a sturdy grabber to accomplish this goal.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We had a grabber in the house but it was the one that can fold! Stay away from those because when you pick up an item that is at all heavy the grabber folds in half and you cannot get the item... so we bought these and we are so happy... I tried it out right away... and it helped me get things down from a high shelf...even a 4 pound bag of sugar! YUP! It works... very happy with it! Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Bambs

customer_reviews.title: Unstoppable!!
customer_reviews.text: As a 5'1" women I'm so happy my friends bought me this! I can finally reach the top shelves without having to rock climb around my house or grab a chair to stand on. Its great for anything under 10 pounds and is incredibly sturdy! It feels flimsy but this is seriously strong. Just don't try to grab anything heavy and you'll be fine. Also, grip the item you want completely, as in, squeeze the handle all the way! I dropped a book on my foot not doing that thinking the stick would break.
customer_reviews.author: LARA K CALHOUN

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this grabber to pick up both small sticks and limbs weighing up to about 5 pounds. It makes for a day free of many stoops to the ground to pick up sticks. My wife also has one that she uses in the house to help reach things stored high on shelves or deep in closets or storage rooms. With common sense use (like not trying to pick up a refrigerator with it) it is a sturdy and very handy tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Sharp

customer_reviews.title: An Invaluable Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of what I regard as a nearly invaluable tool. I’m handicapped (a nasty problem with my left leg) and your outstanding product has “saved the day” on a number of occasions. Being able to reach with this tool instead of trying to squat to pick up something off the floor makes this tool invaluable and as time has gone on I’m learning new tricks that the tool helps me with. A great purchase and a well- made product.
customer_reviews.author: lguess

customer_reviews.title: Best grabber
customer_reviews.text: We use these grabbers to pick up trash on the beach near our beach home - we buy several at a time and give them to others who also help to clean up the beach - I think I have purchased about 10 of these and have been using some of them for years - except of course the ones we gave away - if anyone buys a home near our beach house we buy them 2 of these as housewarming gifts!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Williams

customer_reviews.title: I love it !
customer_reviews.text: Love it it works great getting high items out of the cupboard it’s very sturdy I occasionally will use it to nab one of those huge summer time roaches the ones you try to kill & they just don’t die I tried to vacuum one up once it wouldn’t vacuum up!!!! I use this to grab those nasty things it throw it away of course they come over from my neighbors house
customer_reviews.author: Christine1026

customer_reviews.title: Best Grabber Ever
customer_reviews.text: This grabber replaced an almost identical tool that finally wore out after years of service. It helped me pick up sticks and other post-storm debris on our lawn Immediately on arrival. I like it even more than its predecessor. It has a 32" reach that is perfect for a 5'10" septuagenarian. Also good for my helpmate and love of 49 years. It does not fold and does not have a locking jaw feature. I disliked both those features on the old one. All in all a perfect choice with fair price, very quick delivery and great quality and function.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: No very well made.
customer_reviews.text: I like the length of this product but my issues are with the trigger and the small black bushing at the end of the shaft. The small black bushing is always sliding off the shaft and the trigger sticks to the point that most times it needs to be pulled back open. Am very disappointed with this product but going to the trouble of returning it. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: atticmom

customer_reviews.title: Some weaknesses compared to other grabbers of this type
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time using this grabber to pick up litter and one of the nuts that holds the suction cups on fell off. I lost the nut in the debris, but was able to find a replacement at home and get it working again. This model uses a strand of metal cable to connect the grabbing mechanism to the trigger, which broke on a previous Vive grabber I owned. I have the same type of grabber by EZ-Grabber, bought at Orchard Supply Hardware, but the connection is made with a strip of metal rather than a cable, which so far has been more robust.
customer_reviews.author: E.C. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Suction Cup Reacher Grabber
customer_reviews.text: A friend lent me their grabber after I had surgery and couldn't bend down to pick things up. It worked so well, I bought one for myself, even though I no longer need it due to surgery. It is great for reaching things behind the bed and taking laundry out of the new washer machines that are really deep. Also for getting things out of the top shelf in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: Agape Filled

customer_reviews.title: I don't need it for everyday use but thought it would be useful to have
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I don't need it for everyday use but thought it would be useful for grabbing clothes which fall behind the washing machine, getting items off high shelves, and reaching the things in the cabinets above the refrigerator. I'm not disappointed. My only concern is the handle and trigger are plastic so I don't know how long it will last. It does have a lifetime guarantee so I'm not really worried about it.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Best Grabber Around!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different styles of grabbers and this, IMHO, is the best!!! My last one that is lost somewhere in the house!!! was the one that the end looked like a "U" shape. I didn't care for it...it didn't open wide enough to grab cans off a shelf. And this one allows one to grab the smallest of things! I haven't tried changing a light bulb yet, but from the manner of design, I believe it will work just fine! I say, buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

product_meta.title: Vive Suction Cup Reacher Grabber - 32" Heavy Duty Mobility Grip Hand Aid - Handle Tool Light Bulb Remover, iPad Pickup, Long Handled Trash Litter Picker, Garbage Garden Nabber Extender Arm
feature_bullets: Easily extend your reach: adding 32” to your reach, the suction Reacher allows you to easily reach items stored on high shelves, dropped behind furniture or other tight places, and items on the ground without constant bending and twisting. Great for those with limited dexterity, arthritis, carpal tunnel, or those recovering from surgery or injury.

Secure rubber suction cup tips: easily change light bulbs without using a hazardous step stool. Strong rubber suction cups provide a secure grip on any item, including smooth or slippery objects like glass or metal, without damaging the surface. The wide leaf-style jaws close tight enough to retrieve dropped Coins or pills with ease while having the strength to hold items weighing up to five pounds.
Ergonomic trigger handle: the comfort grip handle is ergonomically designed to fit easily in either hand for versatility and also includes a built-in hanger for convenient storage when not in use.

Lightweight and durable: constructed with a durable, corrosion-resistant aluminum, The suction Reacher is is suitable for indoor/outdoor use. The frame is lightweight to reduce arm and hand fatigue from constant use.
Lifetime guarantee: Lifetime money back guarantee. We stand behind our products and ensure your satisfaction.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,928 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
